alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 07 at 2:36AM EST until March 07 at 4:45AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Indiana, south central Indiana, southwest Indiana and west central Indiana, including the following counties, in central Indiana, Bartholomew, Johnson, Morgan and Shelby. In south central Indiana, Brown, Jackson, Lawrence and Monroe. In southwest Indiana, Greene. In west central Indiana, Owen. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 236 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bloomington, Columbus, Shelbyville, Franklin, Martinsville, Bloomfield, Spencer, Nashville, Ellettsville, Edinburgh, Flat Rock, Worthington, Princes Lakes, Morristown, Trafalgar, Morgantown, Fairland, Clifford, Stinesville and Helmsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
